title: I'm starting to obsess over math problems. Is that normal? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, it’s normal and OK if its a positive kind of obsession: the math problems fascinate and intrigue you, challenge you to solve them, and you find thinking about them and solving them stimulating; aka, if it makes you happy. It’s important though to NOT let your obsession take over your whole life and stop you from getting sufficient sleep, stop you from getting enough healthy physical exercise, stop you from eating enough nutritious foods, stop you from socializing with friends and family, or stop you from spending sufficient time studying your other subjects at school, etc.

Math Problems are a workout for the brain. So, naturally, if you were to work out for the first time and an attractive person noticed you, you would want to work out more. My point is, of you see better results, your more likely to improve on what makes you good.
